Modify y-axis

Source: R/jp_dw_scale_y.R
jp_dw_scale_y.Rd

Customize the scale limits and breaks for a y-axis that maps a continuous variable.

jp_dw_scale_y(chart_id, y_var, max = "max", min = "min", num_ticks = 5)

Arguments

chart_id

String. Datawrapper chart id.
y_var

String. The variable name mapped on the y-axis.
max

Integer. The upper limit of the scale. Defaults to the highest value in the variable.
min

The lower limit of the scale. Defaults to the lowest value in the variable. Also takes an integer and “truncated”, which leaves some one-third space of the plot area at the bottom empty for a chart that doesn’t start at zero.
num_ticks

Integer. Number of axis ticks. Defaults to 5. The total number of ticks that appears on the chart will be num_ticks + 1 as it includes the lower limit of the axis.

See also

dw_edit_chart for the underlying function.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
jp_dw_scale_y(
  chart_id = "4BcD3",
  y_var = "lifeExp",
  min = 0,
  num_ticks = 5
)
}
